Whole Brain Catalog

The Whole Brain Catalog is a project dedicated to creating a compelling graphical framework for representing the anatomy of the brain down to the cellular and sub-cellular levels.

See:
          Description

Packages
edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.app Contains classes at the application level for launching the whole program.
edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.core.atlas Provides services that manage the mouse reference atlas.
edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.core.changes Provides functionality for revision control within the environment.
edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.core.data Provides access to the Cell-Centered Database, in order to retrieve 2D and 3D image data.
edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.core.scene Defines classes related to objects that are visible and the functions that manage and organize those objects.
edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.core.scene.tangible Provides models of objects that can be rendered in the visual scene.
edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.core.semantic Provides access to ontology databases and data structures.
edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.core.spatial Provides multiple overlapping coordinate systems and wrappers around jME vectors.
edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.observers Provides observers which shuttle data between "model" classes and "view" classes, as in the Model-View-Controller design.
edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.util Classes that provide basic functionality useful to classes in many different packages.
edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.view Provides the basic root classes for the "view" part of the model-view-controller architecture.
edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.view.gui2d All 2D HUD classes such as menus, popups, browsers, tree widgets, etc.
edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.view.procedural Provides procedural rendering of objects in the visual space (not yet implemented).
edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.view.scene Draws the "view" version of explicitly defined objects in the scene.

 

The Whole Brain Catalog is a project dedicated to creating a compelling graphical framework for representing the anatomy of the brain down to the cellular and sub-cellular levels. Currently, the catalog is being built as a prototype using many open source libraries.

  • Whole Brain Catalog architecture
